basis: The user explicitly commits to a concrete, small action (tiny bite + water) and a 20–30 minute check-in, framing it as doable. This alignment with the suggestion indicates a high likelihood the intended action will be carried out.
cognitive_dissonance: The user acknowledges the plan is tough but chooses to implement it, showing manageable tension between craving urges and the plan. Likely to experience intermittent internal debate but maintains commitment.
negative_thought_patterns: Occasional self-doubt about ability to sustain the plan; anticipatory worry about cravings; occasional perfectionistic wording ('if I don’t feel settled') that could undermine confidence over time.
emotional_triggers: Cravings/urge to eat, heat/ambient discomfort from warm evening, desire for control and predictability, concern about needing care team support.
coaching_notes: Continue offering simple, concrete actions and quick check-ins. Reinforce self-efficacy with brief progress prompts and remind about support channels. Adapt plan to maintain realism in warm environments; consider adding short cooling strategies (water, light movement) to support urge management.
